CONJUGATES: franker | frankest | frankly | frankness | franks | franked | franking
ETYMOLOGY: From Old French franc ('free, noble, sincere, open'), ultimately derived from the Germanic tribal name Frank, referring to their status as free men.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Open, honest, and direct in speech or writing, often even when the truth is difficult or uncomfortable.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 坦诚的；直率的；诚实的（尤其指涉及敏感或困难话题时）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: To be frank with you, I don't think that solution will work.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 坦白地说，我不认为那个解决方案会奏效。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To mark a letter or package with an official signature or stamp indicating that postage has been paid or is not required (often used for official or government mail).
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 盖邮戳（表示已付邮资或免邮资，尤指官方信件）；免费寄送。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The senator had the envelope franked before it was sent out.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这名参议员在信封寄出前为其盖上了免邮戳。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A member of the Germanic people who established a large kingdom in Western Europe in the 5th to 9th centuries, eventually forming the basis of modern France and Germany.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 法兰克人（一个日耳曼民族成员，在5至9世纪建立了西欧大帝国，是现代法国和德国的基础）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Charlemagne, King of the Franks, founded the Carolingian Empire.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 法兰克国王查理曼建立了加洛林帝国。
